object_id.description: A uuid or otherwise unique identifier for this object

persist.description: Persist this object in the database (default true = persist on server)

type.description: One of the message types: object (3D A-Frame Object), scene-options, landmarks, program (derived from 'type' select above)

action.description: One of 3 basic Create/Update/Delete actions or a special client event action (e.g. a click)

url.description: Model URL. Store files paths under 'store/users/<username>' (e.g. store/users/wiselab/models/factory_robot_arm/scene.gltf); to use CDN, prefix with 'https://arena-cdn.conix.io/' (e.g. https://arena-cdn.conix.io/store/users/wiselab/models/factory_robot_arm/scene.gltf)
url.title: Url

collision-listener.description: Name of the collision-listener, default can be empty string
collision-listener.title: Collision Listener

hide-on-enter-ar.description: Hide object when entering AR. Remove component to *not* hide
hide-on-enter-ar.title: Hide in AR

parent.description: Parent's object_id. Child objects inherit attributes of their parent, for example scale and translation.
parent.title: Parent

screenshareable.description: Whether or not a user can screenshare on an object
screenshareable.title: Screenshare-able

animation.description:
Animate and tween values. 

More properties at https://aframe.io/docs/1.3.0/components/animation.html

autoplay.description: Whether or not the animation should autoplay. Should be specified if the animation is defined for the animation-timeline component (currently not supported).

delay.description: How long (milliseconds) to wait before starting.

dir.description: Which dir to go from from to to.

dur.description: How long (milliseconds) each cycle of the animation is.

easing.description: Easing function of animation. To ease in, ease out, ease in and out.

elasticity.description: How much to bounce (higher is stronger).

enabled.description: If disabled, animation will stop and startEvents will not trigger animation start.

from.description: Initial value at start of animation. If not specified, the current property value of the entity will be used (will be sampled on each animation start). It is best to specify a from value when possible for stability.

isRawProperty.description: Flag to animate an arbitrary object property outside of A-Frame components for better performance. If set to true, for example, we can set property to like components.material.material.opacity. If property starts with components or object3D, this will be inferred to true.

loop.description: How many times the animation should repeat. If the value is true, the animation will repeat infinitely.

pauseEvents.description: Comma-separated list of events to listen to trigger pause. Can be resumed with resumeEvents.

property.description: Property to animate. Can be a component name, a dot-delimited property of a component (e.g., material.color), or a plain attribute.

resumeEvents.description: Comma-separated list of events to listen to trigger resume after pausing.

startEvents.description: Comma-separated list of events to listen to trigger a restart and play. Animation will not autoplay if specified. startEvents will restart the animation, use pauseEvents to resume it. If there are other animation components on the entity animating the same property, those animations will be automatically paused to not conflict.

to.description: Target value at end of animation.

type.description: Right now only supports color for tweening isRawProperty color XYZ/RGB vector values.

animation.title: Animation

armarker.description: A location marker (such as an AprilTag, a lightAnchor, or an UWB tag), used to anchor scenes, or scene objects, in the real world.

publish.title: publish
publish.description: Publish detections. Send detections to external agents (e.g. external builder script that places new markers in the scene). If dynamic=true and publish=true, object position is not updated (left up to external agent).

dynamic.title: dynamic
dynamic.description: Dynamic tag, not used for localization. E.g., to move object to which this ARMarker component is attached to. Requires permissions to update the scene (if dynamic=true).

markerid.title: markerid
markerid.description: The marker id (e.g. for AprilTag 36h11 family, an integer in the range [0, 586])

armarker.title: ARMarker

dynamic-body.description:
Physics type attached to the object. 

More properties at https://github.com/n5ro/aframe-physics-system#dynamic-body-and-static-body
dynamic-body.title: Physics

impulse.description: The force applied using physics. Requires click-listener
impulse.title: Impulse

landmark.title: Landmark
landmark.description: Define entities as a landmark; Landmarks appears in the landmark list and you can move (teleport) to them; You can define the behavior of the teleport: if you will be at a fixed or random distance, looking at the landmark, fixed offset or if it is contrained by a navmesh (when it exists)

randomRadiusMin.description: Minimum radius from the landmark to teleport to. (randomRadiusMax must > 0)

randomRadiusMax.description: Maximum radius from the landmark to teleport to.

offsetPosition.description: Use as a static teleport x,y,z offset

constrainToNavMesh.description: Teleports should snap to navmesh. Valid values: 'false', 'any', 'coplanar'

startingPosition.description: Set to true to use this landmark as a scene start (spawn) position. If several landmarks with startingPosition=true exist in a scene, one will be randomly selected.

lookAtLandmark.description: Set to true to make users face the landmark when teleported to it.

label.description: Landmark description to display in the landmark list

material-extras.description:
Define extra material properties, namely texture encoding, whether to render the material's color and render order. The properties set here access directly Three.js material component. 

More properties at https://threejs.org/docs/#api/en/materials/Material

overrideSrc.description: Overrides the material in all meshes of an object (e.g. a basic shape or a GLTF); Use, for example, to change the texture of a GLTF.

colorWrite.description: Whether to render the material's color.

renderOrder.description: Allows the default rendering order of scene graph objects to be overridden.

transparentOccluder.description: If `true`, will set `colorWrite=false` and `renderOrder=0` to make the material a transparent occluder.

material-extras.title: Material extras

rotation.description: 3D object rotation in degrees by default; Right-handed coordinate system. Switches to quaternion representation if 'w' is given
rotation.title: Rotation

cast.description: Whether the entity casts shadows onto the surrounding scene
cast.title: cast shadow

receive.description: Whether the entity receives shadows from the surrounding scene
receive.title: receive shadow

sound.description:
The sound component defines the entity as a source of sound or audio. The sound component is positional and is thus affected by the component's position. 

More properties at https://aframe.io/docs/1.3.0/components/sound.html

autoplay.description: Whether to automatically play sound once set.

distanceModel.description: Sound model: linear, inverse, or exponential.

loop.description: Whether to loop the sound once the sound finishes playing.

maxDistance.description: Maximum distance between the audio source and the listener, after which the volume is not reduced any further.

on.description: An event for the entity to listen to before playing sound.

poolSize.description: Numbers of simultaneous instances of this sound that can be playing at the same time

positional.description: Whether or not the audio is positional (movable).

refDistance.description: Reference distance for reducing volume as the audio source moves further from the listener.

rolloffFactor.description: Describes how quickly the volume is reduced as the source moves away from the listener.

src.description: URL path to sound file e.g. 'store/users/wiselab/sound/wave.mp3'

volume.description: How loud to play the sound

sound.title: Positional Sound

frame_object.description: URL of a thumbnail image, e.g. 'store/users/wiselab/images/conix-face-white.jpg'

video_object.description: Name of object where to put the video, e.g. 'square_vid6'

video_path.description: URL of the video file, e.g. 'store/users/wiselab/videos/kungfu.mp4'

anyone_clicks.description: Responds to clicks from any user

animation-mixer.description:
A list of available animations can usually be found by inspecting the model file or its documentation. All animations will play by default. To play only a specific set of animations, use wildcards: animation-mixer='clip: run_*'. 

More properties at https://github.com/n5ro/aframe-extras/tree/master/src/loaders#animation

clampWhenFinished.description: If true, halts the animation at the last frame.

clip.description: Name of the animation clip(s) to play. Accepts wildcards.

crossFadeDuration.description: Duration of cross-fades between clips, in seconds.

duration.description: Duration of the animation, in seconds (0 = auto).

repetitions.description: Number of times to play the clip, in addition to the first play. Repetitions are ignored for loop: once.

timeScale.description: Scaling factor for playback speed. A value of 0 causes the animation to pause. Negative values cause the animation to play backwards.

animation-mixer.title: Animation Mixer

gltf-model-lod.description: Simple switch between the default gltf-model and a detailed one when a user camera is within specified distance

detailedUrl.title: detailedUrl
detailedUrl.description: Alternative 'detailed' gltf model to load by URL

detailedDistance.title: detailedDistance
detailedDistance.description: At what distance to switch between the models

updateRate.title: updateRate
updateRate.description: How often user camera is checked for LOD (default 333ms)

retainCache.title: retainCache
retainCache.description: Whether to skip freeing the detailed model from browser cache (default false)

gltf-model-lod.title: GLTF Model Level of Detail
